site_description: Would you like to find out how books were written in the olden days?
button_continue_freely: I can see you don't need me anymore, cya!

guide_messages.stage_1_1: Hundreds of years ago, people wrote all books by hand on animal skin. These were called manuscripts. Let’s make our own!
guide_messages.stage_1_2: To start we have to prepare the page. Here is the entire skin stretched in front of you. Let’s clean it a bit. Take the scraping knife and scrape all the dots out!
guide_messages.stage_1_4: Now, take the other  knife, and cut the page as big as you like! What do you think is the best shape?
guide_messages.stage_1_6: It’s time to cover the page with some powder. This will make the ink stick to the page.
guide_messages.stage_1_8: Lines will help us keep the letters straight. I made some dots for you,  connect them from left to right to make lines.
guide_messages.stage_1_10: Your page is ready for writing! Here are some tools you can use: dip the feather in ink to write, if you make a mistake, use the  knife like a rubber to erase it.
guide_messages.stage_1_12: Well done! Your manuscript looks amazing! You’ve just won a star.
guide_messages.stage_1_13: Wow, this was hard work. Remember how you took the knife to erase words? In the olden days, people did that to entire books! Let’s try!
guide_messages.stage_1_15: Woah! This was fun. Are there books at home you would like to erase? Bad news: knives only work on animal skin, called parchment.
guide_messages.stage_1_16: Are you ready to write again? Have fun!
guide_messages.stage_1_18: Good job, you just created a palimpsest! Palimpsests are books that are erased and written again. Here is your second star!

guide.dragon: Nice to meet you,  I ́m Ethelflaed and I ́m a dragon living in a castle.
guide.rabbit: Hello, my name is Edwina and I ́m a rabbit knight.
